verses.kjv: And again the anger of the LORD was kindled against Israel, and he moved David against them to say, Go, number Israel and Judah.
verses.web: Again LORD’s anger burned against Israel, and he moved David against them, saying, “Go, count Israel and Judah.”
verses.ct: Once again the LORD's anger burned against Israel. He stirred up David against them, saying, "Go and count the people of Israel and Judah."

verses.kjv: For the king said to Joab the captain of the host, which was with him, Go now through all the tribes of Israel, from Dan even to Beersheba, and number ye the people, that I may know the number of the people.
verses.web: The king said to Joab the captain of the army, who was with him, “Now go back and forth through all the tribes of Israel, from Dan even to Beersheba, and count the people, that I may know the sum of the people.”
verses.ct: So the king told Joab, the commander of his army who was with him, "Travel through every tribe of Israel, from Dan all the way down to Beersheba, and count the people. I want to know how many there are."

verses.kjv: And Joab said unto the king, Now the LORD thy God add unto the people, how many soever they be, an hundredfold, and that the eyes of my lord the king may see it: but why doth my lord the king delight in this thing?
verses.web: Joab said to the king, “Now may LORD your God add to the people, however many they may be, one hundred times; and may the eyes of my lord the king see it. But why does my lord the king delight in this thing?”
verses.ct: Joab replied, "May the LORD your God multiply the people a hundred times over, and may you live to see it happen! But why does my lord the king want to do this?"

verses.kjv: Notwithstanding the king’s word prevailed against Joab, and against the captains of the host. And Joab and the captains of the host went out from the presence of the king, to number the people of Israel.
verses.web: Notwithstanding, the king’s word prevailed against Joab, and against the captains of the army. Joab and the captains of the army went out from the presence of the king to count the people of Israel.
verses.ct: But the king's order overruled Joab and the army commanders. So Joab and the commanders left the king's presence to go count the people of Israel.

verses.kjv: And they passed over Jordan, and pitched in Aroer, on the right side of the city that lieth in the midst of the river of Gad, and toward Jazer:
verses.web: They passed over the Jordan, and encamped in Aroer, on the right side of the city that is in the middle of the valley of Gad, and to Jazer;
verses.ct: They crossed the Jordan and set up camp in Aroer, on the south side of the city in the middle of the valley of Gad, and then moved on toward Jazer.

verses.kjv: Then they came to Gilead, and to the land of Tahtimhodshi; and they came to Danjaan, and about to Zidon,
verses.web: then they came to Gilead, and to the land of Tahtim Hodshi; and they came to Dan Jaan, and around to Sidon,
verses.ct: From there they went to Gilead and on to the land of Tahtim Hodshi. Then they traveled to Dan Jaan and around toward Sidon.

verses.kjv: And came to the strong hold of Tyre, and to all the cities of the Hivites, and of the Canaanites: and they went out to the south of Judah, even to Beersheba.
verses.web: and came to the stronghold of Tyre, and to all the cities of the Hivites, and of the Canaanites; and they went out to the south of Judah, at Beersheba.
verses.ct: They reached the fortress of Tyre and passed through all the cities of the Hivites and the Canaanites. Finally, they headed south through Judah all the way to Beersheba.

verses.kjv: So when they had gone through all the land, they came to Jerusalem at the end of nine months and twenty days.
verses.web: So when they had gone back and forth through all the land, they came to Jerusalem at the end of nine months and twenty days.
verses.ct: After traveling through the entire land, they returned to Jerusalem 9 months and 20 days later.

verses.kjv: And Joab gave up the sum of the number of the people unto the king: and there were in Israel eight hundred thousand valiant men that drew the sword; and the men of Judah were five hundred thousand men.
verses.web: Joab gave up the sum of the counting of the people to the king: and there were in Israel eight hundred thousand valiant men who drew the sword; and the men of Judah were five hundred thousand men.
verses.ct: Joab reported the final count to the king: Israel had 800,000 fighting men who could handle a sword, and Judah had 500,000.

verses.kjv: And David’s heart smote him after that he had numbered the people. And David said unto the LORD, I have sinned greatly in that I have done: and now, I beseech thee, O LORD, take away the iniquity of thy servant; for I have done very foolishly.
verses.web: David’s heart struck him after he had counted the people. David said to LORD, “I have sinned greatly in that which I have done. But now, LORD, put away, I beg you, the iniquity of your servant; for I have done very foolishly.”
verses.ct: But after the census was complete, David's conscience hit him hard. He said to the LORD, "I have sinned terribly by doing this. Please, LORD, forgive your servant's guilt, because I have acted like a fool."

verses.kjv: For when David was up in the morning, the word of the LORD came unto the prophet Gad, David’s seer, saying,
verses.web: When David rose up in the morning, LORD’s word came to the prophet Gad, David’s seer, saying,
verses.ct: The next morning when David got up, the LORD sent a message to the prophet Gad, who served as David's seer.

verses.kjv: Go and say unto David, Thus saith the LORD, I offer thee three things; choose thee one of them, that I may do it unto thee.
verses.web: “Go and speak to David, ‘LORD says, “I offer you three things. Choose one of them, that I may do it to you.” ’ ”
verses.ct: "Go tell David that the LORD says this: 'I'm giving you 3 choices. Pick one, and I will carry it out against you.'"

verses.kjv: So Gad came to David, and told him, and said unto him, Shall seven years of famine come unto thee in thy land? or wilt thou flee three months before thine enemies, while they pursue thee? or that there be three days’ pestilence in thy land? now advise, and see what answer I shall return to him that sent me.
verses.web: So Gad came to David, and told him, and said to him, “Shall seven years of famine come to you in your land? Or will you flee three months before your foes while they pursue you? Or shall there be three days’ pestilence in your land? Now answer, and consider what answer I shall return to him who sent me.”
verses.ct: So Gad went to David and laid out the options: "Should 7 years of famine strike your land? Or would you rather run from your enemies for 3 months while they chase you down? Or should a plague sweep through your land for 3 days? Think it over and tell me what answer to bring back to the one who sent me."

verses.kjv: And David said unto Gad, I am in a great strait: let us fall now into the hand of the LORD; for his mercies are great: and let me not fall into the hand of man.
verses.web: David said to Gad, “I am in distress. Let us fall now into LORD’s hand; for his mercies are great. Let me not fall into man’s hand.”
verses.ct: David told Gad, "This is an impossible choice. But let us fall into the LORD's hands, because his mercy is great. Don't let me fall into human hands."

verses.kjv: So the LORD sent a pestilence upon Israel from the morning even to the time appointed: and there died of the people from Dan even to Beersheba seventy thousand men.
verses.web: So LORD sent a pestilence on Israel from the morning even to the appointed time; and seventy thousand men died of the people from Dan even to Beersheba.
verses.ct: So the LORD sent a plague across Israel from that morning until the appointed time, and 70,000 people died throughout the land, from Dan to Beersheba.

verses.kjv: And when the angel stretched out his hand upon Jerusalem to destroy it, the LORD repented him of the evil, and said to the angel that destroyed the people, It is enough: stay now thine hand. And the angel of the LORD was by the threshingplace of Araunah the Jebusite.
verses.web: When the angel stretched out his hand toward Jerusalem to destroy it, LORD relented of the disaster, and said to the angel who destroyed the people, “It is enough. Now withdraw your hand.” LORD’s angel was by the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite.
verses.ct: When the angel reached out his hand toward Jerusalem to destroy it, the LORD relented from the disaster and told the angel who was striking down the people, "Enough! Pull back your hand." At that moment, the angel of the LORD was standing at the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite.

verses.kjv: And David spake unto the LORD when he saw the angel that smote the people, and said, Lo, I have sinned, and I have done wickedly: but these sheep, what have they done? let thine hand, I pray thee, be against me, and against my father’s house.
verses.web: David spoke to LORD when he saw the angel who struck the people, and said, “Behold, I have sinned, and I have done perversely; but these sheep, what have they done? Please let your hand be against me, and against my father’s house.”
verses.ct: When David saw the angel striking down the people, he cried out to the LORD, "I'm the one who sinned! I'm the one who did wrong! But these people — they're like innocent sheep. What did they do? Please, let your hand fall on me and my family instead."

verses.kjv: And Gad came that day to David, and said unto him, Go up, rear an altar unto the LORD in the threshingfloor of Araunah the Jebusite.
verses.web: Gad came that day to David, and said to him, “Go up, build an altar to LORD on the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite.”
verses.ct: That same day Gad came to David and said, "Go up and build an altar to the LORD on the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite."

verses.kjv: And David, according to the saying of Gad, went up as the LORD commanded.
verses.web: David went up according to the saying of Gad, as LORD commanded.
verses.ct: So David went up and did what Gad said, just as the LORD had commanded.

verses.kjv: And Araunah looked, and saw the king and his servants coming on toward him: and Araunah went out, and bowed himself before the king on his face upon the ground.
verses.web: Araunah looked out, and saw the king and his servants coming on toward him. Then Araunah went out, and bowed himself before the king with his face to the ground.
verses.ct: When Araunah looked out and saw the king and his servants approaching, he went out and bowed facedown on the ground before the king.

verses.kjv: And Araunah said, Wherefore is my lord the king come to his servant? And David said, To buy the threshingfloor of thee, to build an altar unto the LORD, that the plague may be stayed from the people.
verses.web: Araunah said, “Why has my lord the king come to his servant?” David said, “To buy your threshing floor, to build an altar to LORD, that the plague may be stopped from afflicting the people.”
verses.ct: Araunah asked, "Why has my lord the king come to visit his servant?" David answered, "To buy your threshing floor so I can build an altar to the LORD and stop this plague from killing more people."

verses.kjv: And Araunah said unto David, Let my lord the king take and offer up what seemeth good unto him: behold, here be oxen for burnt sacrifice, and threshing instruments and other instruments of the oxen for wood.
verses.web: Araunah said to David, “Let my lord the king take and offer up what seems good to him. Behold, the cattle for the burnt offering, and the threshing instruments and the yokes of the oxen for the wood.
verses.ct: Araunah said to David, "Take whatever you need, my lord the king, and offer your sacrifice. Here — take the oxen for the burnt offering, and use the threshing sledges and ox yokes for firewood."

verses.kjv: All these things did Araunah, as a king, give unto the king. And Araunah said unto the king, The LORD thy God accept thee.
verses.web: All this, O king, does Araunah give to the king.” Araunah said to the king, “May LORD your God accept you.”
verses.ct: Araunah offered all of this to the king with royal generosity. Then he added, "May the LORD your God accept you."

verses.kjv: And the king said unto Araunah, Nay; but I will surely buy it of thee at a price: neither will I offer burnt offerings unto the LORD my God of that which doth cost me nothing. So David bought the threshingfloor and the oxen for fifty shekels of silver.
verses.web: The king said to Araunah, “No; but I will most certainly buy it from you for a price. I will not offer burnt offerings to LORD my God which cost me nothing.” So David bought the threshing floor and the oxen for fifty shekels of silver.
verses.ct: But the king told Araunah, "No — I insist on paying you a fair price. I won't offer burnt offerings to the LORD my God that cost me nothing." So David bought the threshing floor and the oxen for 50 shekels of silver.

verses.kjv: And David built there an altar unto the LORD, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings. So the LORD was intreated for the land, and the plague was stayed from Israel.
verses.web: David built an altar to LORD there, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings. So LORD was entreated for the land, and the plague was removed from Israel.
verses.ct: David built an altar to the LORD there and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings. The LORD answered his prayer for the land, and the plague over Israel was stopped.
